articles.headline: How Is Scott Walker Like Reagan? He’ll Tell You
articles.snippet: The Wisconsin governor, who envisions competing against candidates named Bush and Clinton, is introducing himself to voters as a product of the Reagan Revolution.
articles.abstract: The Wisconsin governor, who envisions competing against candidates named Bush and Clinton, is introducing himself to voters as a product of the Reagan Revolution.
articles.lead_paragraph: Just before 8 a.m. on Feb. 6, Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin went on Twitter to wish a happy 22nd anniversary to “my lovely bride Tonette,” and included a wedding photo of the couple in gown and tails. An hour later on Twitter, Mr. Walker posted a photo of another object of his affection: “Today,” he wrote, “is the 104th anniversary of President Ronald Reagan’s birth!”

articles.headline: Shabab Militants Learning to Kill on a Shoestring
articles.snippet: The militants from Somalia remain murderously effective despite the loss of territory, fighters and money, having learned to adapt.
articles.abstract: The militants from Somalia remain murderously effective despite the loss of territory, fighters and money, having learned to adapt.
articles.lead_paragraph: NAIROBI, Kenya — They have lost their leader, their ports, their checkpoints and their territory.

articles.headline: Waving Cash, Putin Sows E.U. Divisions in an Effort to Break Sanctions
articles.snippet: The Russian president has mended issues with Cyprus and has courted Greece as Moscow seeks to assert influence in some of Europe’s most troubled corners.
articles.abstract: The Russian president has mended issues with Cyprus and has courted Greece as Moscow seeks to assert influence in some of Europe’s most troubled corners.
articles.lead_paragraph: NICOSIA, Cyprus — When Cyprus seized hundreds of millions of dollars from bank depositors, many of them Russians, as part of an internationally brokered deal two years ago to rescue its collapsing financial system, the Russian leader, Vladimir V. Putin, denounced the move as “dangerous” and “unfair,” warning of a sharp chill in relations.

articles.headline: U.S. Defense Secretary Supports Trade Deal With Asia
articles.snippet: The move was an unusual entry by the Pentagon into the world of trade politics.
articles.abstract: The move was an unusual entry by the Pentagon into the world of trade politics.
articles.lead_paragraph: TEMPE, Ariz. — Defense Secretary Ashton Carter on Monday threw the weight of the Pentagon behind President Obama’s fight to push a trade deal with Asia through Congress, warning that Asian markets are being gobbled up by global competitors.

articles.headline: Kris Bryant, the Baseball Players’ Union and a Lesson for Labor
articles.snippet: Labor might do well to heed baseball, where solidarity between its stars and lesser players has been critical to bargaining success since the mid-’60s.
articles.abstract: Labor might do well to heed baseball, where solidarity between its stars and lesser players has been critical to bargaining success since the mid-’60s.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Chicago Cubs opened the 2015 season Sunday night with a 3-0 loss against the St. Louis Cardinals, and one glaring absence: Kris Bryant, the team’s budding superstar. The Cubs sent Bryant down to the minor leagues last week, setting off a 21st-century-style labor dispute.

articles.headline: Big Companies Pay Later, Squeezing Their Suppliers
articles.snippet: To help their cash flows, food and packaged goods companies are delaying payments to suppliers, a practice that at one time signaled trouble.
articles.abstract: To help their cash flows, food and packaged goods companies are delaying payments to suppliers, a practice that at one time signaled trouble.
articles.lead_paragraph: How would you like to have 120 days to pay your creditors?

articles.headline: University of Virginia Fraternity to Go After Rolling Stone for Rape Article
articles.snippet: The fraternity at the center of a retracted article by Rolling Stone said it planned to pursue legal action against the magazine, but it will not be an easy case.
articles.abstract: The fraternity at the center of a retracted article by Rolling Stone said it planned to pursue legal action against the magazine, but it will not be an easy case.
articles.lead_paragraph: The University of Virginia fraternity at the center of a retracted article by Rolling Stone magazine that detailed a purported gang rape by its members said on Monday that it planned “to pursue all available legal action against the magazine.”

articles.headline: Laurence Tribe Fights Climate Case Against Star Pupil From Harvard, President Obama
articles.snippet: The liberal legal scholar Laurence H. Tribe, who taught Barack Obama at Harvard, represents the coal company Peabody Energy in its challenge to E.P.A. rules.
articles.abstract: The liberal legal scholar Laurence H. Tribe, who taught Barack Obama at Harvard, represents the coal company Peabody Energy in its challenge to E.P.A. rules.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Laurence H. Tribe, the highly regarded liberal scholar of constitutional law, still speaks of President Obama as a proud teacher would of a star student. “He was one of the most amazing research assistants I’ve ever had,” Mr. Tribe said in a recent interview. Mr. Obama worked for him at Harvard Law School, where Mr. Tribe has taught for four decades.

articles.headline: G.O.P. Senator, Bob Corker, Is Key Player in Iran Accord
articles.snippet: Few people on Capitol Hill are more important to the White House now than Senator Bob Corker, the Republican behind a bill to force President Obama to send any deal with Iran to Congress for approval.
articles.abstract: Few people on Capitol Hill are more important to the White House now than Senator Bob Corker, the Republican behind a bill to force President Obama to send any deal with Iran to Congress for approval.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — While negotiators toiled late into the night in Switzerland, scratching together a nuclear agreement with Iran, Senator Bob Corker was conducting his own tense talks back home.
articles.byline: By Ashley Parker and Peter Baker

articles.headline: In Republican Attacks on the Fed, Experts See a Shift
articles.snippet: Democrats used to propose most bills to change the Federal Reserve, but that has changed in recent years.
articles.abstract: Democrats used to propose most bills to change the Federal Reserve, but that has changed in recent years.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — At a hearing in February, Representative Scott Garrett, a New Jersey Republican, complained that Congress and the Federal Reserve had traded places.
